column16: Puccinellia distans is a PERENNIAL growing to 0.6 m (2ft).  It is in flower from June to July. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Wind.  Suitable for: light (sandy) and medium (loamy) soils. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils and can grow in saline soils. It can grow in  semi-shade (light woodland) or no shade. It prefers  moist or  wet soil.
